wiki.content: Considered by Paul Simon to be the best song he ever wrote. According to an article in the London Times, this is an account of Paul Simon's marriage break-up with his first wife Peggy Harper. The nine-year-old "travelling companion" he refers to is their son Harper, who three years later, at the age of 12 accompanied his father on the Graceland tour. (Source Graceland Songfacts). User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Considered by Paul Simon to be the best song he ever wrote. According to an article in the London Times, this is an account of Paul Simon's marriage break-up with his first wife Peggy Harper. The nine-year-old "travelling companion" he refers to is their son Harper, who three years later, at the age of 12 accompanied his father on the Graceland tour. (Source Graceland Songfacts).

track.name: Graceland
comments: I can't think of a song that flows more majestically than this one.
Paul Simon said himself Graceland was the best song he ever recorded.
The best song ever... It really might be
Einer der besten Songs aller Zeiten, genialer Künstler!
MarvellousG got it bang on! It's in my top 5 albums of all time
His best song, and one of THE best songs of all time.
losing love is like a window in your heart might be his best lyric
Understated emotional, beauty on so many levels, legendary track.
This was my first record. Yes. Record.
I love the rollicking bass. Beautiful. Currently playing on repeat.
How can you not dance to this song?  : -)
There is so much South Africa in this song ...
love it .... love it .... LOVE IT ! ♥
there's a girl in New York City, calls herself the human trampoline....
